main event: A single silver/blue object was observed moving up, down, and back and forth at high speeds (800-1000 mph) with a humming sound in Carrollton, Ohio on August 2, 1956.
interesting points: The object changed color from silver to blue with a glowing red fringe.
The object was observed for 20 seconds and had been seen for the past two days.
The witness was an amateur observer, not a trained observer.
The Air Force requested a preliminary investigation by the local AISS unit.
There is a mention of a message regarding this sighting, but the context is unclear.
sighted object: a single cigar-shaped object that changed color
